column4: Has anyone else got the error in 6.10 while trying to install where X fails and just says "no screens found".
It looks like a bunch of directories are missing.
I can't acces anything.
I am trying to install Ubuntu when this happens.
It happens shortly after selecting the first option in the boot menu after I boot from the CD.
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop might fix the issue
once X spits you out, it should throw you to a terminal. but you can also hit alt+ctrl+f1 and login there
the livecd also have the alt+ctrl+f1 thing like an installed system

but in the liveCD, as long as you are sure the CD is not corrupt, issue sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and choose vesa when it asks you to choose a driver. then I think startx should start X for you. have a look at the bug link Lynoure sent above though.
no, you can either modify the xorg.conf of the liveCD sesiion while it's runing, or that of your installed system...
what exactly happens when you hit ctrl+alt+f1 after X failed to start?
yes, the liveCD acts like an installed ubuntu system
pls type my whole nick, that's how your mesages get flagged for me to see easier
I'm a little confused... which cd are you trying to use to install?
desktop cd is the same as a liveCD
yes
then login at the screen you are presented with and then type sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
when it asks you to choose a driver, select vesa
when all is done, restart x with the command startx
this should fix the liveCD. once the system installs, you may have to do the same thing after booting to your *installed* system -done -hope this helps
you're most welcome, hope it fixes the issue -don't forget to check the bug report link someone posted a little above
